definition: Thatcher (name)/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990

sentences.english: Mrs. Thatcher was almost crazed ; and Aunt Polly, also.
sentences.chinese: 撒切爾夫人幾乎神經失常，還有波莉姨媽也是。

sentences.english: He heard the voice of a woman who worked for the Thatchers.
sentences.chinese: 他聽見撒切爾家的女僕的聲音。

sentences.english: It would appear that the reasons go deeper than Thatcher's frail health.
sentences.chinese: 其中的原由似乎遠超過撒切爾夫人虛弱的健康狀況。

sentences.english: The Enemy Within remains the clue to Thatcher's psychological makeup surely?
sentences.chinese: 《內敵》還是沿着撒切爾的心理特徵這一線索嗎？

sentences.english: Mrs Thatc her spoke the language of the small shopkeeper from her native Lincolnshire.
sentences.chinese: 撒切爾夫人講的是自己家鄉林肯郡的小店主的語言。

sentences.english: Strong and true and not natural fans of Thatcher.
sentences.chinese: 熱情而真實但不正常的撒切爾的粉絲們。

sentences.english: “Thatcher and Scargill deserved each other, nobody else did,” he says.
sentences.chinese: “撒切爾和斯卡吉爾真是絕配，”他說。

sentences.english: Downing Street was packed with well-wishers and photographers when Thatcher arrived.
sentences.chinese: 當撒切爾到達的時候，唐寧街擠滿了祝賀者和攝影師。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Thatcher's sometimes hectoring, sometimes condescending manner irritated many voters.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，撒切爾的風格還是惹惱了許多選民。

sentences.english: This program was filmed at the Thacher School in California.
sentences.chinese: 這集節目錄制於加利福尼亞州的撒切爾學校。
不過，撒切爾還是以自己的準繩貫徹實施了法律。
